title: sesterceshop
author: sesterceshop
content: Brand Finance came out with a report last week of their Top 100 companies by brand value. Brand value refers to the monetary worth and reputation of a brand in the market. It represents the financial impact a brand has on a company, and it's calculated based on various factors such as brand recognition, customer loyalty, market position, and overall perception among consumers and stakeholders.Here are the Top 10 most valuable brands in the world in 2023 so far and their brand value in billions:1. Amazon - $299.32. Apple - $297.53. Google - $281.44. Microsoft - $191.65. Walmart - $113.86. Samsung Group - $99.77. ICBC - $69.58. Verizon - $67.49. Tesla - $66.210. TikTok/Douyin - $65.7https://www.visualcapitalist.com/top-100-brand-value-2023/Any brands that you expected to see in the Top 10 but didn’t? Surprising to see that TikTok/Douyin is now becoming the most valuable social media brand in the world. I guess people really love watching lip-syncing celebrities.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: Amazon, Google, and Apple are to be expected to dominate the market. These three are used by majority of the population, with their ties to technology, market, education, and general every day lives of the people. TikTok is surely making a name for itself as more and more users and brands are using it for marketing and entertainment.

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: Calculating the monetary value of a brand seems pointless to me. Nobody would pay 299 billion only for the sake of owning the brand "Amazon". The actual people, who work in the company are the ones, who make the brand valuable. The brand "Amazon" would be worthless, if Amazon was managed poorly and the customers were unsatisfied. The same thing applies to Google, Apple, Samsung and the rest of the companies. I'm not a big fan of Tesla and TikTok, but who cares. The company's brand is just a shiny package without any content inside.By the way, I'm surprised that Meta/Facebook/Instagram isn't in the TOP 10. Maybe that's why Zuckerberg is desperate, so he created this "Threads" app.

Amazon - $299.32. Apple - $297.53. Google - $281.44. Microsoft - $191.65. Walmart - $113.86. Samsung Group - $99.77. ICBC - $69.58. Verizon - $67.49. Tesla - $66.210. TikTok/Douyin - $65.7https://www.visualcapitalist.com/top-100-brand-value-2023/The concept of brand value was first coined in the 1980s when consumer goods manufacturers were forced to offer discounts to increase sales. In this case, many organizations are interested in increasing the brand value with patience. Anyone who works in the marketing world knows how important a brand is to an organization and in many cases its value is more valuable than the assets or equipment of the organization. Among the many assets that an organization possesses, one of the most important is its brand value.

comments.body: Tiktok is really a surprising entry to this list. Tiktok's biggest market is US and you will be surprised to know that Tiktok is not accessible in China. Chinese government wants their kid to stay away from such distraction so they have banned it. It's available in China in the name of Douyin and it's a heavily regularised version of Tiktok. The actual people, who work in the company are the ones, who make the brand valuable. The brand "Amazon" would be worthless, if Amazon was managed poorly and the customers were unsatisfied. Technically a brand doesn't have a value, but it holds aspirational value. That's why you will see celebrities promoting brand. It does two things - generate trust and create aspirational value.

comments.author: komisariatku
comments.body: Yes, it seems that the top 3 list is very famous and everyone knows it. But even though Amazon has a large capitalization value, they never distribute dividends to their shareholders. They always use their profits for business development, so maybe that's one of the reasons why they are always at the forefront.Do shareholders lose money because they never get stock dividends?No, of course not. Even though Amazon never distributes dividends to shareholders, their share value always goes up. In the last 10 years, the value of Amazon's stock has increased by up to 20% annually, which is a larger amount when compared to the dividend payout. Apart from Amazon, Google and Apple also do not distribute dividends to shareholdershttps://www.suredividend.com/amazon-dividend/
